definitions: sleeveless undershirt or vest worn underneath other clothing
quantum state of a system with zero net angular momentum
single unaccompanied item or individual unit from a collection
examples: He wore a white singlet beneath his dress shirt
The athlete competed in a running singlet and shorts
The electron exists in a singlet state with paired spins
Scientists observed the singlet oxygen molecule in the experiment
Each singlet from the collection was sold separately
The store offered singlets rather than complete sets

definitions: person who lives alone or remains unmarried by choice
child born alone rather than as part of multiple birth
design pattern ensuring only one instance of a class exists
playing card that is the only one of its suit in hand
examples: The singleton enjoyed living independently in her apartment
Many singletons prefer the freedom of solo travel
Unlike her twin brothers, she was a singleton birth
The couple's first child was a singleton
The database connection uses a singleton pattern for efficiency
Implement the logger as a singleton to avoid duplicates
He played his singleton diamond on the third trick
With only a singleton spade, she had to trump early

definitions: grammatical number denoting one person, thing, or instance
exceptional or remarkable quality that stands out from others
examples: The word 'child' is singular while 'children' is plural
Use the singular form when referring to one item
Her singular talent for music impressed everyone at the audition
The discovery was of singular importance to medical science

definitions: point at which something becomes infinite or undefined mathematically
hypothetical future point when artificial intelligence surpasses human intelligence
region in spacetime where gravitational forces cause matter to have infinite density
examples: The function has a singularity at x equals zero
Mathematical singularities occur where equations become undefined
Futurists predict the singularity will occur within this century
The technological singularity could transform human civilization completely
Nothing can escape from a black hole's singularity
The gravitational singularity exists at the center of black holes

definitions: basin with water supply and drainage used for washing dishes
bathroom fixture with basin and faucets for washing hands and face
device or substance that absorbs or dissipates heat or energy
natural depression in land where water collects with no outlet
examples: She filled the kitchen sink with soapy water for dishes
The double sink made meal preparation much more efficient
He brushed his teeth at the bathroom sink every morning
The pedestal sink gave the bathroom an elegant look
The aluminum heat sink keeps the processor from overheating
Carbon dioxide sinks help reduce atmospheric greenhouse gases
The geological sink formed over thousands of years of erosion
Water collected in the natural sink during heavy rains

definitions: weighted object attached to fishing line to sink bait or lure
fast baseball pitch that drops sharply as it reaches home plate
ring-shaped fried doughnut that sinks when placed in liquid
examples: He attached a lead sinker to get his bait deeper
The heavy sinker helped cast the line farther from shore
The pitcher's sinker fooled batters with its late movement
His two-seam sinker was nearly impossible to hit solidly
The coffee shop served fresh sinkers with morning coffee
Old-fashioned sinkers were denser than modern doughnuts

definitions: depression in ground caused by collapse of surface layer into underground cavity
situation or thing that consumes resources without producing results
examples: A massive sinkhole opened in the parking lot overnight
The limestone bedrock made the area prone to sinkholes
The project became a financial sinkhole for the company
That old car is a sinkhole for maintenance money

definitions: gradual downward movement or submersion of something into liquid or soft ground
uncomfortable feeling of anxiety or impending doom in one's stomach
examples: The sinking of the ship took less than three hours
They noticed the gradual sinking of the foundation
She had a sinking feeling when she saw the test results
A sinking sensation filled him as the truth became clear

definitions: person who commits sins or violates religious laws and principles
someone who acts against accepted moral or ethical standards
examples: The preacher called for sinners to repent and seek forgiveness
According to doctrine, all humans are sinners needing redemption
He considered himself a sinner for breaking his promise
Even small lies make us sinners in some people's eyes

definitions: air-filled space within bones of face connected to nasal cavity
mathematical curve showing relationship between angle and opposite side ratio
channel or cavity in body tissue particularly for blood or lymph flow
examples: Her sinus infection caused severe headaches and congestion
The doctor examined his frontal and maxillary sinuses
Students plotted the sinus curve on their graphing calculators
The sinus function repeats every 360 degrees
Blood flows through the venous sinus back to the heart
The dural sinus drains blood from the brain

definitions: very small amount of liquid taken into mouth at one time
minimal quantity or portion of something abstract or concrete
examples: She took a cautious sip of the hot coffee
He savored each sip of the expensive wine
Give me just a sip of information about the project
That's only a sip of what we need to accomplish

definitions: tube used to transfer liquid from higher to lower level using atmospheric pressure
aquatic mollusk with tubular organ for drawing in and expelling water
method of illegally diverting money or resources from legitimate purposes
examples: He used a siphon to drain gasoline from the tank
The aquarium siphon helps clean debris from the gravel
The siphon filtered plankton from the surrounding seawater
Marine siphons attach themselves to rocks and coral
They discovered employees had siphoned funds into personal accounts
The corrupt official siphoned millions from public projects

definitions: polite form of address for a man whose name is unknown
title used before name of knight or baronet in British system
examples: Excuse me, sir, you dropped your wallet
The waiter asked 'What would you like, sir?'
Sir Paul McCartney received his knighthood in 1997
Sir Isaac Newton made groundbreaking scientific discoveries

definitions: male parent of an animal especially horses used for breeding
respectful form of address for a king or male sovereign
male ancestor or forefather in a family lineage
examples: The stallion was a champion sire with many winning offspring
This bull has sired over two hundred calves
'Yes, sire,' the knight replied to his king
Your majesty, sire, the enemy approaches our borders
His sire came from Scotland in the eighteenth century
The family traced their lineage back to noble sires

definitions: loud warning device that makes wailing sound for emergencies
mythological creature depicted as woman-bird or mermaid who lured sailors
dangerously attractive woman who leads others into difficult situations
examples: The fire truck's siren echoed through the neighborhood
The tornado siren gave residents time to seek shelter
Odysseus tied himself to the mast to resist the sirens
Ancient Greek sirens sang beautiful songs to shipwreck sailors
She was a siren who charmed men into ruin
The movie portrayed her as a dangerous siren

definitions: strong white fiber obtained from leaves of Mexican agave plant
rope or twine made from processed agave plant fibers
examples: The sisal plantation exported fiber for rope production worldwide
Sisal fiber is valued for its strength and durability
The ship used sisal ropes for rigging and mooring
Cat scratching posts are often wrapped with sisal

definitions: boy or man regarded as weak, effeminate, or unmanly in behavior
person who lacks courage or appears timid and fearful
examples: Bullies called him a sissy for preferring art to sports
The outdated term 'sissy' reflects harmful gender stereotypes
Don't be such a sissy about getting the injection
He felt like a sissy for being afraid of spiders

definitions: female person having same parents as another person
woman belonging to religious order or community
woman regarded as fellow member of group or cause
thing related or similar to another in origin or structure
examples: My sister and I shared a bedroom growing up
She has two older sisters and one younger brother
Sister Mary taught at the Catholic elementary school
The sisters lived in the convent next to the church
She called her fellow activists sisters in the movement
The sorority sisters supported each other through college
Our company merged with its sister organization last year
The sister cities maintained cultural exchange programs

definitions: feeling of kinship and mutual support among women sharing experiences or goals
society or community of women in religious order living together
state or relationship of being sisters by birth or adoption
examples: The women's group promoted sisterhood and empowerment
Their sisterhood helped them overcome workplace discrimination
She joined the sisterhood after years of spiritual preparation
The sisterhood operated schools and hospitals in the region
Their sisterhood remained strong despite living in different countries
The sisterhood between the twins was immediately apparent

definitions: plucked string instrument from India with long neck and resonating gourd chamber
examples: Ravi Shankar popularized the sitar in Western music
The sitar's distinctive sound comes from its sympathetic strings

definitions: television comedy series with recurring characters in common environment dealing with humorous situations
examples: The sitcom ran for nine successful seasons on primetime
Classic sitcoms like 'Friends' still attract new viewers

definitions: specific place or position where something is located or occurs
location on internet identified by unique address containing web pages
area of ground where building work or excavation takes place
examples: The archaeological site revealed ancient pottery fragments
They chose a site near the river for their camp
Visit our site for more information about products
The site crashed due to overwhelming traffic
Workers must wear helmets on the construction site
The building site was cleared for the new mall

definitions: person who temporarily cares for children in parents' absence
person who poses for portrait or artistic representation
easy opportunity or target in sports or other activities
examples: The sitter arrived at seven to watch the children
We found a reliable sitter through the neighborhood network
The artist asked the sitter to remain still for hours
Professional sitters helped artists complete their portraits
The striker missed an absolute sitter in front of goal
That question was a sitter on the exam

definitions: continuous period of being seated for particular activity or purpose
period during which court or legislature is conducting business
period when bird remains on eggs to incubate them
examples: She read the entire book in one sitting
The portrait required three sittings to complete
Parliament extended the sitting to debate the urgent bill
The court's morning sitting addressed several cases
The hen maintained her sitting for twenty-one days
During sitting, the bird rarely leaves the nest

definitions: combination of circumstances existing at particular time and place
position of employment or professional role within organization
location or position of something in relation to surroundings
examples: The financial situation required immediate attention from management
We need to assess the situation before making decisions
She found a situation as governess with a wealthy family
The employment situation improved after the factory opened
The house enjoys a pleasant situation overlooking the valley
The strategic situation of the fort controlled the pass

definitions: cardinal number between five and seven represented as 6
cricket score when ball is hit over boundary without bouncing
examples: She bought six apples at the grocery store
The die showed a six on its face
The batsman hit three sixes in the final over
That six cleared the stadium roof completely

definitions: former British coin worth six old pence or one-fortieth of a pound
examples: She found an old sixpence in her grandmother's jewelry box
The song mentions sixpence as payment for the blackbirds

definitions: cardinal number equal to six plus ten represented as 16
examples: She celebrated her sixteenth birthday with a party
The chess board has sixteen pieces for each player

definitions: number sixteen in a sequence or ordinal position
one part when something is divided into sixteen equal parts
musical note having time value of one-sixteenth of whole note
examples: The sixteenth century saw major explorations and discoveries
She finished sixteenth in the marathon race
Add one sixteenth of a cup of sugar to mixture
The recipe calls for three-sixteenths of an inch
Practice the sixteenth notes slowly before increasing tempo
The rapid sixteenth note passages challenged the pianist

definitions: number six in a sequence or ordinal position
one part when something is divided into six equal parts
musical interval spanning six scale degrees
examples: She finished sixth in the swimming competition
The sixth grade students went on a field trip
Cut the pizza into sixths for equal portions
One sixth of the voters supported the proposal
The major sixth creates a bright, consonant sound
Play a sixth above the root note

definitions: number sixty in a sequence or ordinal position
one part when something is divided into sixty equal parts
examples: They celebrated their sixtieth wedding anniversary with family
The sixtieth parallel marks an important geographic boundary
A sixtieth of an hour equals one minute
The angle measures three sixtieths of a degree

definitions: cardinal number equal to six times ten represented as 60
decade of years from sixty to sixty-nine in century or person's life
examples: The speed limit here is sixty miles per hour
There are sixty seconds in one minute
The nineteen-sixties brought major social changes
She's in her sixties but still very active

definitions: physical dimensions, proportions, magnitude, or extent of an object
standardized measurement used for clothing, shoes, or other items
relative extent or importance of something abstract or concrete
examples: The size of the room surprised the visitors
Measure the size before ordering replacement parts
She wears a size eight in most dress brands
These shoes run large, so order a size smaller
The size of the problem became apparent during investigation
We need to consider the size of our investment

definitions: process of sorting or adjusting things according to size specifications
gelatinous or resinous substance used to glaze paper or stiffen textiles
examples: The factory uses automated sizing to sort products
Proper sizing ensures the parts fit together correctly
The artist applied sizing to prepare the canvas
Paper sizing prevents ink from bleeding through

definitions: boot with blade attached for gliding over ice surface
shoe with wheels attached for rolling on smooth surfaces
flat-bodied cartilaginous fish related to rays living on ocean floor
examples: She laced up her skates before stepping onto the ice
The hockey player sharpened his skates before the game
His inline skates needed new wheels and bearings
Roller skates were popular at the disco rink
The skate buried itself in the sandy ocean bottom
Fishermen caught several skates in their nets

definitions: short board mounted on wheels used for riding and performing tricks
examples: His skateboard had custom graphics on the deck
She practiced tricks on her skateboard at the park

definitions: person who rides skateboards as sport, recreation, or transportation
examples: Professional skateboarders compete for prize money worldwide
The skateboarder performed an impressive kickflip

definitions: action sport of riding and performing tricks on a skateboard
examples: Skateboarding became an Olympic sport in 2020
He took up skateboarding as a teenager

definitions: person who performs on ice skates for sport or recreation
person who uses roller skates or skateboards for sport or recreation
examples: The figure skater won three gold medals
Speed skaters train for hours on the ice
The skater performed tricks at the skate park
Inline skaters gathered for the marathon event

definitions: sport or activity of gliding on ice wearing ice skates
activity of moving on roller skates or inline skates
examples: Figure skating requires grace and athletic ability
They went skating on the frozen pond
Roller skating was popular entertainment in the 1970s
Inline skating provides excellent cardiovascular exercise

definitions: shooting sport where clay targets are launched from two fixed stations
examples: He won the national skeet shooting championship
The club offers both trap and skeet shooting

definitions: internal framework of bones supporting vertebrate animal body
basic structure or framework underlying or supporting a system
minimum number of people needed to operate facility or service
examples: The museum displayed a complete dinosaur skeleton
The human skeleton contains 206 bones
Engineers designed the building's steel skeleton first
The skeleton of the argument was sound but needed details
A skeleton crew maintained the factory during holidays
The hospital operated with a skeleton staff overnight

definitions: person inclined to question or doubt accepted opinions or claims
adherent of philosophical skepticism questioning possibility of knowledge
examples: Climate skeptics challenged the scientific consensus
She remained a skeptic despite the compelling evidence
Ancient skeptics argued that certain knowledge was impossible
Philosophical skeptics question our ability to know truth

definitions: attitude of doubt or disposition to incredulity about claims or statements
philosophical position that true knowledge or certainty is impossible
examples: Her skepticism about the project proved well-founded
Healthy skepticism helps evaluate extraordinary claims
Philosophical skepticism challenges our assumptions about reality
David Hume's skepticism influenced modern philosophy

definitions: rough or unfinished drawing or painting showing main features
brief written or spoken account giving main points
short humorous performance or piece in comedy show
examples: The artist made a quick sketch of the landscape
Her pencil sketch captured the subject's expression perfectly
He gave a brief sketch of the proposal
The book includes biographical sketches of each president
The comedy sketch about office life was hilarious
Saturday Night Live features multiple sketches each episode

definitions: book of blank pages used for drawing sketches and making artistic notes
examples: The artist carried her sketchbook everywhere for inspiration
His sketchbook contained ideas for future paintings

definitions: long runner curved upward at front used to glide over snow
similar device used for gliding over water when pulled by boat
examples: She waxed her skis before hitting the slopes
The rental shop offered various ski lengths
He fell off the water ski at high speed
Water skis require different technique than snow skis

definitions: uncontrolled sliding movement of vehicle on slippery surface
wooden or metal platform for stacking and moving heavy objects
prolonged period of decline or poor performance
examples: The car went into a skid on the icy road
The driver corrected the skid by steering into it
Workers loaded boxes onto wooden skids for transport
The forklift moved the skid to the warehouse
The team's losing skid reached ten games
His career hit the skids after the scandal

definitions: person who skis on snow for sport, recreation, or transportation
examples: The Olympic skier won three gold medals
Experienced skiers prefer challenging black diamond runs

definitions: small shallow light boat for rowing or sailing by one or two people
examples: They rowed the skiff across the calm lake
The fisherman used a skiff to reach his nets
